An unofficial blog and community resource focused on Kali Linux, providing tutorials, guides, and news related to penetration testing and cybersecurity tools for Indian users. This is not affiliated with the official Kali Linux project (kali.org) maintained by Offensive Security.

description: BuoneNotizie.it is a digital news platform founded in 2001 that focuses on constructive journalism and positive news coverage. The site operates without advertising and partners with the Italian Association of Constructive Journalism.

Virgilio.it operates as a major Italian news aggregator and digital media platform. description: The Guardian is a newspaper and digital news outlet that delivers investigative journalism with a mainstream left-wing editorial stance. ABC7 News Bay Area (KGO-TV) is a local television news station serving the San Francisco Bay Area, providing breaking news coverage, weather forecasts, traffic updates, and live video streaming for San Francisco, Oakland, San Jose and Northern California regions. Official blog of CloudLinux, a commercial Linux operating system provider specializing in web hosting solutions. The blog provides technical updates, product releases, and documentation for CloudLinux OS, CloudLinux's own distro.

Linux Today is a contributor-driven news and information resource focused on Linux operating systems, providing tutorials, guides, and technical news coverage for Linux users and IT professionals

Linux.com is a web resource providing news, tutorials, certifications, and information focused on Linux and open source technology. The platform offers educational content, professional development resources, discussion forums, and job listings for the open source community.

LinuxGizmos is a technology news website launched in February 2013 that focuses on covering Linux and its derivatives in embedded systems, mobile devices, and IoT applications. LWN.net is a reader-supported computing webzine focused on Linux, free software, and open source development, providing comprehensive coverage of technical, legal, commercial and security issues in the free software ecosystem. LXer is an independent Linux and open source news website established in 2004 by Dave Whitinger. The site publishes Linux-related news, opinions, reviews, and community discussions, focusing specifically on free and open source software developments and the Linux ecosystem.

MacRumors is a technology news website and blog focused exclusively on Apple products, software, and ecosystem. It publishes news, rumors, leaks, reviews, and guides about upcoming and existing Apple products.

Macworld is a technology media outlet focused exclusively on Apple products and services, providing news coverage, product reviews, tutorials, and buying advice. Originally started as a print magazine in 1984, it transitioned to digital-only in 2014.

description: MarketWatch is a financial news website and subsidiary of Dow Jones & Company that provides real-time stock market quotes, business news, financial analysis, and investment tools. It offers market commentary, stock research, and personal finance coverage through its website, targeting both retail and institutional investors.

Mashable is a digital media platform and entertainment company founded in 2005 by Pete Cashmore, covering technology, digital culture, social media, and entertainment news. The site receives over 40 million monthly pageviews and serves as a significant source for web-related news, trends analysis, and digital culture coverage.

MMORPG.com is a specialized gaming news and review website focused on massively multiplayer online role-playing games (MMORPGs) and related genres. The site provides game reviews, industry news, game lists, and community features for MMO gaming enthusiasts.

The New York Post is a daily tabloid newspaper based in New York City, established in 1801 by Alexander Hamilton. Known for its conservative editorial stance and sensationalist headlines, it covers local news, politics, sports, entertainment, and business.
Founded in 1933, Newsweek is a weekly news magazine and digital media outlet providing in-depth analysis, news, and opinion about international issues, technology, business, culture, and politics.

PC Magazine is a technology publication established in 1982 that provides product reviews, tech news, and analysis. Originally a print magazine until 2009, it now operates as a digital-only publication offering lab-tested reviews of computers, consumer electronics, software, and tech services.

PCWorld is a technology-focused digital publication that provides news, reviews, analysis, and advice about personal computers, software, hardware, and related technologies. PJ Media is a conservative news and opinion website founded in 2004 (originally as Pajamas Media). The site publishes content focused on politics, culture, faith, and current events from a right-wing perspective, featuring various columnists and contributors who provide commentary and analysis on US political and social issues.
Polygon is a entertainment website founded in 2012 that covers video games, movies, television, and popular culture.

Quartz is a digital news publication founded in 2012 focusing on international business news, economics, technology, and global economy coverage. Originally launched by Atlantic Media, it relies on native advertising and sponsored content for revenue.
Reason is a monthly magazine and media outlet that covers news, politics, culture, and public policy from a libertarian perspective.

Reddit is a social news and discussion platform where users submit content and participate in topic-specific communities called subreddits. The platform combines social networking, news aggregation, and forum features, allowing users to vote on content and engage in discussions.
Rolling Stone is a magazine and media brand founded in 1967 that covers music, politics, and popular culture through investigative reporting, interviews, and cultural commentary.

Founded in 1995, Salon is an independent digital news and opinion website providing progressive coverage of politics, news, culture, science, and entertainment. The publication has progressive/liberal editorial stance.

The San Mateo Daily Journal is a local newspaper serving the San Francisco Peninsula region, specifically focused on San Mateo County, California. The publication provides local news coverage, business updates, and community information through both print and digital formats.
ScienceBlog.com is a science news and research aggregation website that publishes articles covering diverse scientific topics from astronomy to zoology.

ScienceDaily is a science news aggregation website founded in 1995 that publishes edited press releases about scientific research and discoveries from universities, scientific journals, and research organizations.
Seeking Alpha is a crowdsourced financial markets content and analysis platform where investors and market professionals share research, investment ideas, and discuss stocks.

Semafor is a digital news platform founded in 2022 that provides global reporting on politics, business, technology, and climate. It operates with a free, ad-supported model and generates revenue through advertising and events.

SFGATE is a digital news outlet based in San Francisco, California, providing coverage of Bay Area news, sports, culture, weather, politics, and technology. Originally launched as the San Francisco Chronicle's digital presence, it now operates as a separate digital publication covering both local and state-wide California news.

SFist is a digital-first news website focused on San Francisco Bay Area news, covering local politics, restaurants, events, sports, and culture. The site reaches millions of readers and provides both serious news coverage and lighter content about the San Francisco metropolitan area.

Siliconera is a specialized video game news website focused on international gaming coverage, particularly Japanese games and releases, providing news, translations, reviews, and exclusive interviews.

Slashdot is a technology-focused social news website founded in 1997 by by Rob 'CmdrTaco' Malda that allows users to submit and evaluate news stories about science, technology, and politics. Originally known for its 'News for Nerds' tagline, it pioneered user-submitted news and community moderation in tech media, and is notable for the 'Slashdot effect' phenomenon of overwhelming smaller websites through traffic spikes.

Slate is a daily online magazine and podcast network founded in 1996, focusing on politics, news, business, technology, and culture. It operates with a metered paywall model and is known for its contrarian views ('Slate Pitches') and generally liberal editorial stance. The publication combines analysis, commentary, and cultural coverage with a mix of serious journalism and humor.

System76 is a Linux-focused computer manufacturer based in Denver, Colorado that produces laptops, desktops, and servers with pre-installed Linux operating systems. Their blog provides company updates, product announcements, technical articles, and community engagement content.

Tech Xplore is a science and technology news website focused on engineering, electronics, and technology advances. The platform aggregates and publishes research news, technological developments, and innovations from academic institutions and industry.
Techaeris is a technology news and review website that covers tech products, gaming, audio technology, business tech news, and entertainment content including movies, comics, and books.

TechCrunch is a online technology news outlet founded in 2005 that focuses on reporting about startups, technology companies, venture capital funding, and Silicon Valley. It provides breaking news, analysis, and coverage of the global technology industry through articles, events, and databases tracking startup funding and acquisitions.

The American Prospect is a daily online and bimonthly print magazine focused on American politics and public policy, with a progressive and liberal perspective. It provides analysis of public policy issues and political developments through both digital and print formats.

The Associated Press is a global not-for-profit news cooperative founded in 1846 that provides independent journalism through text, photos, video and data to media organizations worldwide. Known for its fact-based reporting and accuracy in election coverage since 1848, it is one of the three most influential news agencies globally alongside Reuters and AFP.
owner: U.S. newspaper and broadcast members (cooperative ownership)

description: The Block is a New York-based digital media company focused on cryptocurrency and digital assets news, research, and analysis.

The Christian Science Monitor is a nonprofit international news organization founded in 1908 that publishes daily articles online and a weekly magazine, known for its thoughtful global coverage and focus on constructive journalism.
owner: The First Church of Christ, Scientist

description: The Daily Hodl is a cryptocurrency and digital assets news website focused on covering Bitcoin, Ethereum, and blockchain technology developments. .

The Daily Signal is a conservative political news and commentary website established in 2014. Initially launched as a project of The Heritage Foundation think tank, it became an independent publication in June 2024. The outlet focuses on policy news, political coverage, and conservative analysis.
The Hill is a Washington D.C.-based political newspaper and digital media company founded in 1994, focusing on Congress, politics, policy, and business coverage.

The Intercept is an American left-wing nonprofit news organization founded in 2014 that publishes investigative journalism, articles, and podcasts focusing on national security, civil liberties, foreign policy, and criminal justice. It gained prominence for being one of the first outlets to report on Edward Snowden's leaked NSA documents.
The Mac Observer is a technology news website and blog focused on covering Apple products, services, and ecosystem, including iPhone, Mac, iPad, and Watch.
The Markup is an investigative journalism organization focused on examining technology's impact on society through data-driven reporting and investigations.

The Mercury News is a daily newspaper based in San Jose, California, serving Silicon Valley and the San Francisco Bay Area with coverage of local news, sports, business, and entertainment. The paper has a daily circulation of about 93,000 and Sunday circulation of around 151,000 as of 2022, making it one of the major metropolitan newspapers in Northern California.
The New York Times is a daily newspaper founded in 1851 that provides news coverage, investigative journalism, and opinion content through print and digital platforms.
owner: The Ochs-Sulzberger Family (through The New York Times Company)

description: The New Yorker is a magazine established in 1925 that publishes journalism, commentary, criticism, essays, fiction, satire, cartoons, and poetry.
The Philadelphia Inquirer is a daily newspaper founded in 1829 serving the Philadelphia metropolitan area. It's known for its investigative journalism and local news coverage.

The San Francisco Standard is an online news organization launched in 2021 that covers daily news, politics, business, food, tech and culture in the San Francisco Bay Area. The publication is funded in part by venture capital and aims to provide local journalism for San Francisco and the surrounding region.

The Verge is a technology news and media website founded in 2011 that covers the intersection of technology, science, art, and culture. It produces news coverage, feature stories, investigative reporting, product reviews, and multimedia content through articles, videos, and podcasts, with headquarters in New York City.

The Wall Street Journal is a daily business and financial news publication that provides comprehensive coverage of U.S. and international news, business, markets, and economics. The newspaper maintains center-right editorial positions.
TIME is a weekly news magazine and digital media platform founded in 1923, covering politics, business, health, science, and entertainment.

Tom's Hardware is a technology news and review website founded in 1996 by Dr. Thomas Pabst, specializing in PC hardware, components, and tech industry coverage. The site provides detailed product reviews, buying guides, and technical analysis for PC enthusiasts, builders, and technology professionals.

VentureBeat is a technology news website founded in 2006, based in San Francisco, that publishes news, analysis, interviews, and features focusing on transformative technology, particularly AI and gaming.
Wccftech is a technology news and media website focused on PC hardware, gaming, and mobile technology coverage through news articles, reviews, and guides.

WIRED is a monthly technology magazine and digital publication founded in 1993 in San Francisco, focusing on how emerging technologies affect culture, economy, politics, and society. The publication covers technology, science, business, and cultural news, with particular emphasis on digital culture and innovation.

Xbox is Microsoft's gaming and entertainment brand that provides video game consoles, cloud gaming services, and digital content distribution. Their blog and website feature gaming news, product announcements, game previews and reviews, developer interviews, community highlights, and technical support resources. The platform offers gaming hardware, software, streaming services through Xbox Cloud Gaming, and online services via Xbox Live, connecting players across console, PC, and mobile devices.

Yahoo is a web services provider offering email, search engine, and a comprehensive web portal. Its Yahoo News service aggregates content from major media organizations and wire services while also producing original reporting through its news team.

ZDNET is a technology news and analysis website that provides coverage of business technology, software, hardware, innovations and enterprise IT through news articles, reviews, and blogs. The site operates a network of about 50 specialized technology blogs covering various verticals including companies, hardware, software, mobile, security and IT research.

AFP is a global news agency founded in 1944 that provides text, photo, video, and graphics to media and institutions worldwide. It operates under a specific French statute designed to safeguard editorial independence.
BRUZZ is a media platform providing news and cultural content for the Brussels region.
Bluewin is a Swiss internet service provider that offers email and a news platform

The Australian Broadcasting Corporation (ABC) is Australia's national public broadcaster, providing news, entertainment, and educational content across television, radio, digital and online platforms.
The Special Broadcasting Service (SBS) is a broadcaster with a particular focus on serving Australia's multicultural and multilingual commumities.

China News Service (CNS) is a state-level news agency in China providing news coverage to the world. Its main subscribers include those from Taiwan, Hong Kong and Macao special administrative regions, overseas Chinese and related foreigners.

It keeps a close watch on smart cars, electric vehicles, AR/VR, virtual reality, Apple iOS/iPadOS, HarmonyOS, Google Android, Microsoft Windows 11/10/7, while tracking the latest trends in digital gadgets like iPhones, iPads, and Android smart devices.

description: The Paper was launched on July 22, 2014, under the supervision and administration of the Shanghai United Media Group, with its predecessor being The Oriental Morning Post established in 2003. Leveraging internet technology innovation while preserving core journalistic values, The Paper continuously produces and aggregates high-quality content spanning politics, ideology, finance, and culture. It stands as one of the most essential converged media content providers for the global Chinese-language internet.
RTBF is the public broadcaster for the French-speaking community in Belgium, offering a wide range of news and entertainment content.
Sporza is a sports-focused brand of VRT, providing comprehensive sports coverage and live broadcasts.
VRT is the Flemish public broadcaster, providing news and cultural content across television, radio, and digital platforms.

ERR News is the Estonian, English and Russian language news service of Estonian Public Broadcasting, providing daily coverage of Estonian and Baltic regional news, politics, culture and current affairs.

Yleisradio Oy (YLE) is Finland's national public broadcasting company, providing television, radio, and digital content services. It is Finland's largest media company and is funded primarily through a broadcasting tax (YLE tax). YLE operates several television and radio channels in Finnish, Swedish, and Sami languages, serving Finland's multilingual population.

France 24 is a French international news channel that broadcasts in English and French. It provides news coverage across various categories including politics, business, sports, and international affairs.

Radio France is a French public radio group, wholly owned by the state, that operates numerous national and local stations, four musical ensembles, and a record label, and is committed to providing independent, pluralistic, and high-quality public service broadcasting.

Established on January 6, 1975, Radio France Internationale (RFI) is a French public international radio station that reaches over 150 countries across five continents and, with 59.5 million listeners in 2022, is one of the world's most listened-to international radio stations.

TV5 Monde, originally TV5, is an international French-language general-interest television channel created on January 2, 1984. Based in Paris, it is jointly owned by public broadcasting companies in France, Belgium, Switzerland, Canada, Quebec, and the Principality of Monaco.

description: Deutsche Welle (DW) is Germany's international public broadcaster providing news, cultural content, and analysis in multiple languages through digital, TV, and radio platforms.
Deutschlandfunk is a German public radio broadcaster and part of Deutschlandradio, providing national news, in-depth reporting, analysis and cultural programming.

Die Bundesregierung is the official website and communication platform of the German Federal Government, providing official information, press releases, and updates about government policies, decisions, and activities.

Rundfunk Berlin-Brandenburg (RBB) is a public broadcaster serving the German federal states of Berlin and Brandenburg, established in 2003. Its focused on regional news, current affairs, and cultural programming for these two states.
Tagesschau is a national television news service and digital news platform operated by ARD-aktuell on behalf of the german public-service broadcaster ARD.

Rai News is the 24-hour news division and online news portal of RAI (Radiotelevisione Italiana), Italy's national public broadcaster. It provides continuous news coverage through its TV channel Rai News 24, digital platform, and website, offering real-time updates on politics, economy, sports, and current affairs in Italy and internationally.

Radio New Zealand (RNZ) is New Zealand's independent public radio service. RNZ broadcasts three nationwide channels, RNZ National, RNZ Concert and the AM network (focused on parliamentary proceedings). RNZ Pacific (which used to operate as Radio New Zealand International or RNZI) is the group's international news broadcaster.

Al Jazeera is an international news network headquartered in Doha, Qatar. It provides news coverage across various categories including politics, business, sports, and international affairs, with a particular focus on Middle Eastern and North African affairs.
RT is a Russian international news channel that broadcasts in English. It provides news coverage across various categories including politics, business, sports, and international affairs.

L1 is the regional public broadcaster of the province of Limburg that provides radio, television, and online news. The broadcaster operates from Maastricht and delivers news and programs about all of Limburg, often also with attention to the Limburgish dialect and regional culture.

The Dutch Broadcasting Foundation (Dutch: Nederlandse Omroep Stichting, NOS) is a public broadcaster established in the Media Act, tasked with providing media content for the national public media service in the areas of news, sports, and events, which are particularly suited for joint coverage.

NPR is a non-profit media organization providing public radio broadcasting and digital content across the United States through a network of member stations. It produces and distributes news, cultural programming, and podcasts with a focus on journalism, arts, and education.
PBS is America's public broadcaster operating through a network of over 350 local stations, offering educational and cultural programming across television and digital platforms.
Voice of America is an international multimedia broadcaster funded by the U.S. government, providing news, information, and cultural programming.
